required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Differences in Radial Artery Occlusion From Two Different Compressive Methods Used in Patients in Order to Achieve Homeostasis After Transradial Catheterization and Their Repercussion in Artery Functionality and Hand Mobility
clinical_study.official_title: Influence of the Compression Method After Transradial Catheterization in Radial Artery

lead_sponsor.agency: Hospital Universitari Vall d'Hebron Research Institute

clinical_study.source: Hospital Universitari Vall d'Hebron Research Institute

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to determine differences on radial artery occlusion from two compressive methods used after transradial catheterization and its functional impact on hand mobility.

detailed_description.textblock: Changes in Allen's test and pulse oximetry will be evaluated at baseline, 1 week and 3 month of catheterization in both groups of patients in order to check the functionality of the communications between the ulnar and radial arteries. The repercussion of each compressive method on radial occlusion and artery revascularization will be assessed by eco-Doppler at any time. Changes in diameter of arterial lumen of radial and ulnar arteries as a consequence of radial occlusion will be done simultaneously of blood flow Doppler measurements. The possible impact of radial occlusion on hand mobility will be done using a dynamometer designed to evaluate strength (Endurance test) and muscular claudication (Rapid exchange test).

primary_outcome.measure: Determination of radial artery occlusion at baseline (before catheterization)
primary_outcome.description: Determination of radial artery occlusion at baseline (before catheterization), 1 week and 3 month after angiography/angioplasty in both compressive methods

primary_outcome.measure: Determination of radial artery occlusion after catheterization
primary_outcome.description: Determination of radial artery occlusion at baseline (before catheterization), 1 week and 3 month after angiography/angioplasty in both compressive methods

primary_outcome.measure: Determination of radial artery occlusion after catheterization
primary_outcome.description: Determination of radial artery occlusion at baseline (before catheterization), 1 week and 3 month after angiography/angioplasty in both compressive methods

secondary_outcome.measure: Anatomic differences in radial and ulnar diameters
secondary_outcome.description: Anatomic differences in arterial lumen of radial and ulnar arteries (diameter)

secondary_outcome.measure: Differences in radial and ulnar blood flow between compression methods
secondary_outcome.description: Differences in radial and ulnar blood flow as a consequence of radial occlusion

secondary_outcome.measure: Differences in functional status at follow between compression groups
secondary_outcome.description: Differences in hand mobility at baseline, 1 week and 3 month of catheterization as a consequence of radial occlusion in relation with the compressive method used to achieve homeostasis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Differences in functional status at follow between compression groups
secondary_outcome.description: Differences in hand mobility at baseline, 1 week and 3 month of catheterization as a consequence of radial occlusion in relation with the compressive method used to achieve homeostasis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Differences in functional status at follow between compression groups
secondary_outcome.description: Differences in hand mobility at baseline, 1 week and 3 month of catheterization as a consequence of radial occlusion in relation with the compressive method used to achieve homeostasis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Differences in functional status between occluded radial cohort and patent radial cohort
secondary_outcome.description: Differences in hand mobility at baseline, 1 week and 3 month in response to radial occlusion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Differences in functional status between occluded radial cohort and patent radial cohort
secondary_outcome.description: Differences in hand mobility at baseline, 1 week and 3 month in response to radial occlusion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Differences in functional status between occluded radial cohort and patent radial cohort
secondary_outcome.description: Differences in hand mobility at baseline, 1 week and 3 month in response to radial occlusion.

arm_group.description: Patients in this arm will receive Terumo after catheterization
Patients in this arm will receive Tensoplast after catheterization

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients in whom at least the diagnostic catheterization has been done successfully by the radial artery route.
- Patients with a negative Allen's Clinical test showing hyperemia before 9 seconds after pressure release over the ulnar artery pulse.
- Patients showing a Barbeau pattern A,B or C with the pulsioximetric test after releasing pressure over the ulnar artery pulse.
- Patients that will be able to do the follow up visits at 1 week and 3 month.
- Signature of informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients in that neither the diagnostic or therapeutic procedure has successfully done via the radial artery route.
- Patients with a positive Allen's test (no hyperemia) after pressure and release over the ulnar artery pulse.
- Patients showing a Barbeau pattern D with the pulsioximetric test after releasing pressure over the ulnar artery pulse.
- Inability to visit at 1 week and 3 month.
- Impossibility to obtain informed consent form

overall_official.last_name: Bruno García del Blanco, MD, PhD
